PageTitle: reset bgp unnumbered peer interface flapping-count
FuncDef: The reset bgp unnumbered peer interface flapping-count command clears the flapping count of BGP unnumbered peers. The reset bgp unnumbered peer interface flapping-count command clears the flapping count of BGP unnumbered peers.
CLIs: reset bgp unnumbered peer interface { <interface-name> | <IfType> <IFNum> } flapping-count
reset bgp ipv6 unnumbered peer interface { <interface-name> | <IfType> <IFNum> } flapping-count

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an interface name.
The value is a string of 1 to 63 characters.

Specifies an interface number.
The value is a string of 1 to 63  case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Indicates the IPv6 unicast address family.

 NOTE: This parameter is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
-

Examples: <HUAWEI> reset bgp unnumbered peer interface 100GE 1/0/1 flapping-count
ExtraInfo:
BGP peer flapping affects the stability of a BGP network and BGP route convergence.
The reset bgp unnumbered peer interface flapping-count command can be used to clear the flapping count of BGP unnumbered peers so that the device can re-collect the flapping count of the BGP peers to monitor and locate BGP network problems.
